attributes.action: Investigate whether the total amount claimed by Jacqui Smith as Housing Allowance amounts to unlawful income tax and national insurance evasion
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Jacqui Smith has claimed up to 24,000 per annum for several years as "housing allowance" whilst living with her sister. 

Such an arrangement would amount to income tax and national insurance evasion in any other context by any other individual and the time has come for the rules of taxation to be applied equally to the general public and Members of Parliament.

If our Government stipulates, and expects, that all members of society should abide by the rules of taxation then it must be the case that MP's, in particular Cabinet Ministers, should lead by example.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
